definitions.definition: A large quantity or number; a great deal.
A separate portion; a number of things taken collectively.
One or more items auctioned or sold as a unit, separate from other items.
A number of people taken collectively.
A distinct portion or plot of land, usually smaller than a field.
definitions.example: a building lot in a city

definitions.definition: That which happens without human design or forethought.
Anything (as a die, pebble, ball, or slip of paper) used in determining a question by chance, or without human choice or will.
The part, or fate, that falls to one, as it were, by chance, or without his planning.
(definite, the lot) All members of a set; everything.
definitions.example: If I were in charge, I'd fire the lot of them.

definitions.definition: An old unit of weight used in many European countries from the Middle Ages, often defined as 1/30 or 1/32 of a (local) pound.
To allot; to sort; to apportion.
To count or reckon (on or upon).
A lot; a great deal; tons; loads.
definitions.example: Don't worry, my family has lots of money.
I care lots about the humane treatment of animals.
